Authors:
James M. Trappe, Michael A. Castellano, Roy E. Halling,
Todd Osmundson, Manfred Binder
Title:
Australasian sequestrate fungi. 18. Solioccasus polychromus
gen. & sp. nov., a brightly colored, hypogeous fungus
Abstract:
Solioccasus polychromus gen. & sp. nov., the most
brightly colored hypogeous fungus known, is described from Papua New
Guinea and tropical northeastern Australia as a probable ectomycorrhizal
associate of various Eucalyptus spp. Phylogenetic analysis places it as
a sister genus to Bothia in the Boletaceae.
